habitat_description:
The Rocky mountain tailed frog is distributed in the Blue Mountains located in the southeast area of Washington, Oregon, the Coast Range of British Columbia north into the Noss River, Willipa Hills, Olympic Mountains, Mendocino County in northern California, central Idaho and the panhandle, western Montana, the Cascade Mountains of British Columbia and a disjunct population on the eastern slope of the Rocky Mountains (Behler and King 1979; Lannoo 2005). 

This species is highly aquatic and individuals can be found along streams only moving into the woods after heavy rains (Nussbaum et al. 1983); The habitat of tadpoles includes swift mountain streams with cobble substrates and prefer colder water temperatures (Lannoo 2005).
